sentence.text: Development and validation of a high-performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry assay for the determination of artemether and its metabolite dihydroartemisinin in human plasma.
A sensitive and selective method is described for the determination of artemether and its active dihydroartemisinin metabolite in human plasma using artemisinin as internal standard

The method consists of a liquid-liquid extraction with subsequent evaporation of the supernatant to dryness followed by the analysis of the reconstituted sample by liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry (LC-MS) in single ion monitoring mode using atmospheric pressure chemical ionization (APCI) as an interface
Chromatography was performed on a C(18) reversed-phase column using acetonitrile-glacial acetic acid 0
The method was fully validated over a concentration range of 5-200 ng/ml using 0
5 ml of human plasma per assay
The method was applied to the quantification of artemether and its metabolite in human plasma of healthy volunteers participating in pharmacokinetic drug-drug interaction studies
